intro: Niedenzuella sericea, commonly known as the silky flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a soft appearance. Niedenzuella sericea is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
